intro: Phyllanthus hirtellus, commonly known as the hairy phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically opposite in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
